visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#00008B) for the axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The data series should represent the monthly average temperature for a year, with the name 'Temperature'. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue to dark blue for the line. Additional configurations: Set the chart margins, background, and legend as specified in the JavaScript code.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart titled 'Monthly Average Temperature'. The chart type is set to 'line', and the x-axis categories represent the months of the year. The y-axis is labeled 'Temperature (°C)' and both axes use a dark blue color (#00008B) for their labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. The data series, named 'Temperature', includes the monthly average temperature values for a year. The line color is customized with a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#00008B). Additional configurations include setting the chart's border width, plot border width, and right margin to 100 pixels. The tooltip displays the series name and the temperature value for each point.
